1. Transparent rendering can be done in two ways.
a. Either through the XML file with a new parameter for geoms. If not specified, default = 1
<geometry>
<parameter type="alpha" value="0" /> <!-- any value between 0 (invisible) and 1 (transparent) -->
</geometry>

b. Or real-time with the matlab function:
sceneSetGeomAlpha('geom_name', alpha); % alpha is between 0 (invisible) and 1 (opaque)

2. Turn collision checking off/on for a particular geom can also be done in one of two ways:
a. Either through the XML file with a new parameter for geoms. If not specified, default = 1
<geometry>
<parameter type="checkcollision" value="0" /> <!-- 0 for no checking, 1 for checking -->
</geometry>

b. Or real-time in Matlab with the following function:
sceneSetGeomCFlag('geom_name', 0); % turns collision checking off for this geom
sceneSetGeomCFlag('geom_name', 1); % turns collision checking back on for this geom

3. Get the value of a mutable variable in Matlab:
[x,y,z] = sceneGetVarValue('variable_name'); % for vector-valued mutable variables
or
x = sceneGetVarValue('variable_name'); % for scalar mutable variables

4. The geometry structure returned in Matlab now reports the new transparent and collision flag:

g = sceneGetGeom('src_stand_top')

g =

              name: 'src_stand_top'
              type: 1
              body: 'src_stand'
       T_body_geom: [4x4 double]
      T_world_geom: [4x4 double]
           ghandle: 0
            params: [1x1 struct]
                fv: 0
             color: [190 190 190]
             alpha: 1
    collisioncheck: 0
